Articles.Content:
Hi,

I have Jebediah on Eve and I want him back! I already have calculated a massive Rocket that could get him into orbit. Now i wanna test that thing before its going to Eve. So is there any way to change Kerbins gravity and atmosphere to get an Eve-testing-ground?

Hyperedit.

It lets you edit planets including atmospheric stuff and gravity.

I suggest building a craft that can get into orbit at half-throttle (or less) with an almost immediate gravity turn on Kerbin. If you also have wheels to drive to a higher elevation then you should be all set.

It's what I did

You can simply hyperedit your rocket to Eve. Would be much simpler than editing Kerbin.

Even better would be to just calculate your delta-V. Using plug-ins like Kerbal Engineer or mechjeb lets you do that automatically. Aim for a +10km/s delta-V rocket.

Thanks for all the answers!

@SofusRud: How did you manage to add those wheels? I tried it, but they always break during touchdown, because of the gravity.

@Sof: Building a 10km/s+ Rocket on Eve and make it possible to land is quite a task...
